Methods summary
public Larabros\Elogram\Http\Response
# get( string $id = 'self' )

Retrieves user information for a user. If no $id is provided,then the ID of the owner of the access token is used instead.

Retrieves user information for a user. If no $id is provided,then the ID of the owner of the access token is used instead.

Parameters

$id
The ID of the user

Returns

public Larabros\Elogram\Http\Response
# getMedia( string $id = 'self', integer|null $count = null, integer|null $minId = null, integer|null $maxId = null )

Retrieves recent media for a user. If no $id is provided, then the ID of the owner of the access token is used instead.

Retrieves recent media for a user. If no $id is provided, then the ID of the owner of the access token is used instead.

Parameters

$id
The ID of the user
$count
Count of media to return
$minId
Return media later than this min_id
$maxId
Return media earlier than this max_id

Returns

Larabros\Elogram\Http\Response

Link

https://instagram.com/developer/endpoints/users/#get_users_media_recent
public Larabros\Elogram\Http\Response
# getLikedMedia( integer|null $count = null, integer|null $maxLikeId = null )

Retrieves all media liked by this user. This method only works for the owner of the access token being used to make the request.

Retrieves all media liked by this user. This method only works for the owner of the access token being used to make the request.

Parameters

$count
Count of media to return
$maxLikeId
Return media liked before this id

Returns

public Larabros\Elogram\Http\Response|null
# find( string $username )

Searches for and returns a single user's information for a user . If no results are found, null is returned.

Searches for and returns a single user's information for a user . If no results are found, null is returned.

Parameters

$username
A username to search for

Returns

# follows( )

# requestedBy( )

public Larabros\Elogram\Http\Response
# setRelationship( string $id, string $action )

Modify the relationship between the owner of the access token and the target user with $id. $action can be one of the following:

Modify the relationship between the owner of the access token and the target user with $id. $action can be one of the following:

  • 'follow'
  • 'unfollow'
  • 'approve'
  • 'ignore'

Parameters

$id
$action

Returns
